trans-unit.source: Simple authorization using an access file

seg-source.mrk: Simple authorization using an access file

target.mrk: Simple authorization using an access file

trans-unit.source: Some JVMs support a simple access file system for controlling JMX access.

seg-source.mrk: Some JVMs support a simple access file system for controlling JMX access.

target.mrk: Some JVMs support a simple access file system for controlling JMX access.

trans-unit.source: simple authorization using an access file

seg-source.mrk: simple authorization using an access file

target.mrk: simple authorization using an access file

trans-unit.source: An access file is formatted the same way as password files (described in <xref href="radminjmxenablepwd.dita#radminjmxenablepwd"></xref>), and associates roles with an access level. Valid access levels are <codeph>readonly</codeph> and <codeph>readwrite</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: An access file is formatted the same way as password files (described in <xref href="radminjmxenablepwd.dita#radminjmxenablepwd"></xref>), and associates roles with an access level.

target.mrk: An access file is formatted the same way as password files (described in <xref href="radminjmxenablepwd.dita#radminjmxenablepwd"></xref>), and associates roles with an access level.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>readonly</codeph> level only allows the JMX client to read an MBean's attributes and receive notifications.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>readonly</codeph> level only allows the JMX client to read an MBean's attributes and receive notifications.

target.mrk: The <codeph>readonly</codeph> level only allows the JMX client to read an MBean's attributes and receive notifications.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>readwrite</codeph> level also allows setting attributes, invoking operations, and creating and removing MBeans.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>readwrite</codeph> level also allows setting attributes, invoking operations, and creating and removing MBeans.

target.mrk: The <codeph>readwrite</codeph> level also allows setting attributes, invoking operations, and creating and removing MBeans.

trans-unit.source: To use an access file for JMX authorization, specify the name of the access file using a system property upon JVM startup:

seg-source.mrk: To use an access file for JMX authorization, specify the name of the access file using a system property upon JVM startup:

target.mrk: To use an access file for JMX authorization, specify the name of the access file using a system property upon JVM startup:

trans-unit.source: The contents of such an access file may look like this:

target.mrk: The contents of such an access file may look like this:

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see "Monitoring and Management Using JMX Technology" at <xref format="html" href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/management/agent.html" scope="external">http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/management/agent.html </xref>.

target.mrk: For more information, see "Monitoring and Management Using JMX Technology" at <xref format="html" href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/management/agent.html" scope="external">http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/management/agent.html </xref>.
